title: Securing Recommender System via Cooperative Training. (arXiv:2401.12700v1 [cs.AI])
abstract: Recommender systems are often susceptible to well-crafted fake profiles, leading to biased recommendations. Among existing defense methods, data-processing-based methods inevitably exclude normal samples, while model-based methods struggle to enjoy both generalization and robustness. To this end, we suggest integrating data processing and the robust model to propose a general framework, Triple Cooperative Defense (TCD), which employs three cooperative models that mutually enhance data and thereby improve recommendation robustness. Furthermore, Considering that existing attacks struggle to balance bi-level optimization and efficiency, we revisit poisoning attacks in recommender systems and introduce an efficient attack strategy, Co-training Attack (Co-Attack), which cooperatively optimizes the attack optimization and model training, considering the bi-level setting while maintaining attack efficiency. Moreover, we reveal a potential reason for the insufficient threat of existing attacks

translated_title: 通过合作训练来保护推荐系统
translated_abstract: 推荐系统往往容易受到精心制作的虚假个人资料的影响，导致推荐结果存在偏见。在现有的防御方法中，基于数据处理的方法不可避免地会排除正常样本，而基于模型的方法则无法同时实现泛化性和鲁棒性。为此，我们提出了一个综合数据处理和鲁棒模型的通用框架，Triple Cooperative Defense（TCD），它采用三个协同模型相互增强数据，从而提高推荐的鲁棒性。此外，考虑到现有攻击方法在平衡双层优化和效率方面存在困难，我们重新审视了推荐系统中的攻击问题，并引入了一种高效的攻击策略，Co-training Attack（Co-Attack），该策略在考虑双层设置的同时，协同优化攻击优化和模型训练，保持攻击的效率。此外，我们揭示了现有攻击威胁不足的一个潜在原因。
tldr: 本研究提出了一种综合数据处理和鲁棒模型的通用框架来保护推荐系统，并引入了一种高效的攻击策略。研究揭示了现有攻击威胁不足的原因。
en_tdlr: This study proposes a general framework that integrates data processing and robust models to secure recommender systems. It also introduces an efficient attack strategy and reveals a potential reason for the insufficient threat of existing attacks.
